org.easylibs.getopt

Class PosixGetopt

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.easylibs.getopt.PosixGetopt

  • public final class PosixGetopt
extends java.lang.Object
    Close implementation of GNU/Unix getopt() method call. Both getopt() and getop_long() functions are implemented through the appropriate use of the correct constructor. Unlike unix call implementation, all options are parsed throug a single call to getopt() method.
    See Also:
    getopt_long(3)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static char ERROR_MISSING_ARG
      An error code that indicates that a recognized option is missing a required argument on the command line.
      static char ERROR_UNRECOGNIZED_OPT
      An error code that indicates the command line option encountered is not recognized.
      static char LONG_OPT
      A status code that indicates the option encountered is of the long form.
      static char NO_MORE_OPTIONS
      A status code that indicates there are no more options on the command line.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PosixGetopt(java.lang.String optstring)
      Instantiates a new posix getopt, akin to unix getopt() call, using only short options.
      PosixGetopt(java.lang.String optstring, java.util.List<PosixLongOption> longopts)
      Instantiates a new posix getopt, akin to unix getopt_long() call, using both short and long options with a callback notification of long option selection.
      PosixGetopt(java.lang.String optstring, PosixLongOption[] longopts)
      Instantiates a new posix getopt, akin to unix getopt_long() call, using both short and long options.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PosixGetopt

        public PosixGetopt(java.lang.String optstring)
        Instantiates a new posix getopt, akin to unix getopt() call, using only short options.
        Parameters:
        optstring - short option string definition
        See Also:
        getopt_long(3)

      • PosixGetopt

        public PosixGetopt(java.lang.String optstring,
                   java.util.List<PosixLongOption> longopts)
        Instantiates a new posix getopt, akin to unix getopt_long() call, using both short and long options with a callback notification of long option selection.
        Parameters:
        optstring - short option string definition
        longopts - long option list of definitions
        See Also:
        getopt_long(3)

      • PosixGetopt

        Parameters:
        optstring - short option string definition
        longopts - long option list of definitions

      • index

        public int index()
        The current index into the command line argument array supplied. You should always check to make sure the index is still within argv array bound with code like this index() < argv.length.
        Returns:
        the int

      • index

        public int index(int inc)
        Returns the current index and increaments the index (post) counter by the specified amount. You should always check to make sure the index is still within argv array bound with code like this index() < argv.length.
        Parameters:
        inc - the inc
        Returns:
        the int

      • optarg

        public java.lang.String optarg()
        This will return short options argument or null if the argument is optional.
        Returns:
        the string

      • optchar

        public char optchar()
        If any error occured bacause an option is missing a required argument, the method will return the option character related to the error.
        Returns:
        the option char

      • optmatch

        Returns:
